subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
I have some really weird things around here if I ever decided to do such an
experiment, such as a 1 1/2 inch Greenlee chassis punch. That's just a start
on the weird objects. They get stranger.
:-)

Zack

On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 5:38 PM, rasterer <rasterer@...> wrote:

>
>
> I chose the chair to help control for 'educated guesses': since after the
> second experiment, everyone knew the shape of the monitor, an educated
> guesser might try to hear results that would be reasonable for what they
> already knew.
>
> Just FYI: I am not beyond balancing a canoe on it if I thought it would be
> in the name of science :-)
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, David Koenig
> <floridajakeblues@...> wrote:
> >
> > So there was a CHAIR on the Monitor of a computer ... RIGHT!!!!
> >
> > On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 6:30 PM, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >

> > > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
> > >
> > >
> > > What was it????
> > >
> > > On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 3:38 PM, <SnowfireL@...> wrote:
> > >
> > >>
> > >> What it is RJ, is there are too many people talking all at once on
> > >> this, and not only that but, there is also the reverse side, they can
> start
> > >> something on one side, and carry on with the reverse side, it is
> usually
> > >> where the voice left off, so one must go back to where it was heard,
> and
> > >> reverse it. I don't think spirit is omnipresent, they are not God or
> Holy
> > >> Spirit, maybe they can't see everywhere, but only make guesses, like
> most
> > >> people do, unless they have some necessary information to give, like
> the
> > >> ones with the info. on the missing girl last year. So, I don't know
> what to
> > >> tell you, maybe, they don't know where you live etc..sf
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> -----Original Message-----
> > >> From: Rj <rasterer@...>
> > >> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>
> > >> Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 3:31 pm
> > >> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> So far, your claims that this is not possible are holding true.
> > >>
> > >>

> > >>
> > >>
> > >> From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
>
> > >> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
> > >> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>
> > >> Date: Monday, July 19, 2010, 12:20 PM
> > >>
> > >>
> > >> DAH! again. There's way to much expectation created in trying to
> guess,
> > >> so participants minds interfere with whatever spirit communication
> there
> > >> might be. You do not understand how this communcations works, nor do
> you
> > >> understand the effects of the observer, you can not seperate the
> observer
> > >> from the event in the pararnormal. therefore any results are
> > >> invalid--before you go puffing your chest out thinking how clever you
> are in
> > >> debunking spirit communication. Even your own expectation that no
> valid
> > >> information will be received is enough to block all information. But
> as
> > >> usual, skeptic/debunker ignore all!
> > >>
> > >> F-S
> > >>
> > >> On Mon, Jul 19, 2010 at 1:03 PM, <SnowfireL@aol. com> wrote:
> > >>
> > >>>
> > >>> RJ. David insists you had an ink pen there, and "he changed it."
> > >>>
> > >>>
> > >>> -----Original Message-----
> > >>> From: rasterer <rasterer@yahoo. com>
> > >>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
> > >>> Sent: Mon, Jul 19, 2010 2:39 pm
> > >>> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Experiment 2 - RESULTS!
> > >>>
> > >>>
> > >>> Thanks to everyone who participated in Experiment 2.
> > >>>
> > >>> On Friday, 7/16/2010 I placed an object on top of my computer
> monitor,
> > >>> right in front of me, and left it there until noon Denver time on
> Monday,
> > >>> 7/19/2010. This experiment asked for participants to determine what
> that
> > >>> object was. Vague or partial answers would not be counted (for
> example, just
> > >>> giving a color, shape, size, what it's made of, etc): we're looking
> for what
> > >>> it is. Answers anyone reveals after noon Denver time Monday won't
> count.
> > >>> Participants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or any other
> means
> > >>> they chose.
> > >>>
> > >>> In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of the object at the
> start
> > >>> of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section (RJ folder) of
> this
> > >>> group. The idea with this file is that you could download it at the
> > >>> beginning of the experiment and 'keep it safe' on your computer. Then
> at the
> > >>> end of the experiment, I would post the password so you can reveal
> the
> > >>> contents of the file. That way, you were in control of the original
> image
> > >>> during the entire time, not me.
> > >>>
> > >>> Passworded pdf: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/
> > >>> RJ/RJ20100716. pdf<
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.pdf>
>
> > >>>
> > >>> The password for that file is: 2plus2isFour
> > >>> Instructions, if you need them for the other files, are also in that
> RJ
> > >>> folder.
> > >>>
> > >>> So to the results:
> > >>>
> > >>> Number of participants: 6
> > >>> Total tries: 29
> > >>> Ambiguous answers: 0
> > >>> Correct answers: 0
> > >>>
> > >>> Object: Chair
> > >>> Object picture: http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/
> > >>> RJ/RJ20100716. jpg<
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ20100716.jpg>
>
> > >>>
> > >>> As a little side experiment, on Monday I also asked if anyone had
> gotten
> > >>> any answers that might indicate an article of clothing (though I did
> not say
> > >>> why I was asking). One theory is that the human operator can be
> influenced
> > >>> by things they already know or suspect, and so interpret audio with
> their
> > >>> own personal 'educated guesses', that would differ from what they
> would hear
> > >>> had they not known those things. This side experiment did indicate
> some
> > >>> support for that theory, since before I mentioned 'articles of
> clothing', no
> > >>> one included an article of clothing in their results. But after I
> mentioned
> > >>> it, several reports of clothing began to appear. I did not add these
> tries
> > >>> to the results above.
> > >>>
> > >>> If anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for improvement,
> let
> > >>> me know. Again, thanks to everyone who participated in this
> experiment.
> > >>>
> > >>>
> > >>
> > >>
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>  
>
